channel.title: Portforwarding Problem
channel.description:
Hello Moparscape,
I'm here for a problem i've been bitting my tounge with for awhile now.. I can't seem to portforward my server! It's annoying, trust me. Anyway, i'm not new with servers, nor portforwarding, i've helped many out on how to do so, but "I" can't do this.... My old router that I used to host games on, went down the shitter, due to it's age i suppose.. lol. Anyway, I got a new router and now have been portforwarding EVERYTHING right, so I believe. But still nothing! the Port 43594 WILL NOT open... I'm not sure what's stoping it. here's a picture.
[IMG]http://i286.photobucket.com/albums/ll86/killacam3160/Untitled-3.png[/img]
see, i have it setup correct, but still it wont work. And when I check out the ports if they're open,
[IMG]http://i286.photobucket.com/albums/ll86/killacam3160/Untitled1.png[/img]
That tells me it's not.. If anyone knows a few solutions, please, let me no, cause this is very annoying.
-ALSO, i've heard about some "Bridge Mode" while i've been researching, and i'm not sure if that's a problem, because my Xbox 360, is wireless, meaning it's connecting to it fine, but please, leave a comment, or PM me, and possibly even Add me on MSN, and maybe we can talk, or TeamView about this.
P.S - My DMZ is Enabled, and set as my Ipv4 Address.
MSN: [email]Killacam3160@live.com[/email]

item.title: Portforwarding Problem
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Typhis Lord Typhis
item.description:
@Lord_Typhis wrote:

[quote=“brandonscarinfo, post:12, topic:378563”][quote author=Lord Typhis link=topic=474432.msg3469223#msg3469223 date=1295160899]

FOR WHAT REASON, TO TELL ME TO GO TO MY ROUTERS DESTINATION THEN ADD THE RANGES IN THEN HIT ‘ENABLE’ AND THEN BINGO IT WORKS! WHEN IT’S NOT BECAUSE I GOT A ‘NEW ROUTER’ MEANING SOMETHINGS MESSED UP! WITH MY DMZ, I’M NOT SURE!

/facepalm/
Don’t get smart with me for helping you. If you got a new router than YOU NEED TO RE-PORTFORWARD. also just re-portforwarding will solve the problem 99% of the time.

You sir are a complete idiot. He got a NEW router. Your not helping at all, all your doing is trolling.

On topic: Are you sure about your uPnP?

P.S: Mabye if that doesn’t work, try Utorrent. As thats what I’m using, since I can’t portforward w/ my router.
[/quote]

The only troll here is god of war. dont call me an idiot kid. 99% of the time the error is needing to re-portforward[/quote]
How is God of war trolling? And your are acting like one, thats why I called you an idiot, because he had already said that he had portforwarded again. Use your brain.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding Problem
item.dc:creator: @Bonjour Bonjour
item.description:
@Bonjour wrote:

Hello Moparscape,

I’m here for a problem i’ve been bitting my tounge with for awhile now… I can’t seem to portforward my server! It’s annoying, trust me. Anyway, i’m not new with servers, nor portforwarding, i’ve helped many out on how to do so, but “I” can’t do this… My old router that I used to host games on, went down the shitter, due to it’s age i suppose… lol. Anyway, I got a new router and now have been portforwarding EVERYTHING right, so I believe. But still nothing! the Port 43594 WILL NOT open… I’m not sure what’s stoping it. here’s a picture.

Untitled-3.png1022×409

see, i have it setup correct, but still it wont work. And when I check out the ports if they’re open,

Untitled1.png792×577

That tells me it’s not… If anyone knows a few solutions, please, let me no, cause this is very annoying.

-ALSO, i’ve heard about some “Bridge Mode” while i’ve been researching, and i’m not sure if that’s a problem, because my Xbox 360, is wireless, meaning it’s connecting to it fine, but please, leave a comment, or PM me, and possibly even Add me on MSN, and maybe we can talk, or TeamView about this.

P.S - My DMZ is Enabled, and set as my Ipv4 Address.

MSN: Killacam3160@live.com
